title: AWS launched
description: AWS launched its first service, Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service), in the United States

title: iPhone Anncounced
description: The first-generation iPhone was announced by thenâ€“Apple CEO Steve Jobs at Macworld, and launched later that year.

title: Facebook launched
description: Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook under the name of 'TheFacebook', he intended to create a website that could connect people around the university. Within twenty-four hours, it had somewhere between twelve hundred and fifteen hundred registrants.

title: World Wide Web Invented
description: Tim Berners-Lee proposed the concept of the World Wide Web, which revolutionized the way information is shared and accessed online.

title: Windows 95 Released
description: Microsoft released Windows 95, a major milestone in personal computing that popularized the graphical user interface and plug-and-play hardware support.

title: Google Founded
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin founded Google in September, introducing a new search engine that would eventually dominate the Internet.

title: Wi-Fi Alliance Formed
description: The Wi-Fi Alliance was founded, standardizing wireless networking technology that would become essential to modern connectivity.

title: YouTube Acquired by Google
description: Google acquired YouTube for $1.65 billion, laying the groundwork for the era of online video streaming.

title: Bitcoin Introduced
description: The concept of Bitcoin, a decentralized cryptocurrency, was introduced by an anonymous person or group known as Satoshi Nakamoto.

title: Instagram Launched
description: Instagram, a photo-sharing social media platform, was launched by Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger, rapidly gaining millions of users.

title: Amazon Echo released
description: Amazon introduced the Echo smart speaker, which popularized voice-activated digital assistants in homes.

title: Python Created
description: Guido van Rossum released Python, a high-level programming language known for its readability and versatility.

title: Microsoft Founded
description: Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft to develop and sell software for personal computers.

title: Apple Founded
description: Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne founded Apple, revolutionizing personal computing.

title: Linux Kernel Released
description: Linus Torvalds released the first version of the Linux kernel, sparking the open-source movement.

title: Java Programming Language Announced
description: Sun Microsystems introduced Java, a platform-independent programming language that became widely adopted.

title: IBM PC Launched
description: IBM introduced its first personal computer, which became a standard in business and home computing.

title: First Email Sent
description: Ray Tomlinson sent the first email, using the @ symbol to separate the user name from the computer name.

title: First Website Published
description: Tim Berners-Lee published the first website, laying the foundation for the modern World Wide Web.

title: First iPod Released
description: Apple introduced the iPod, revolutionizing portable music players and digital music consumption.

title: OpenAI Founded
description: OpenAI was founded with the mission to ensure artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity.

title: Tesla Motors Founded
description: Tesla Motors was founded to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy.

title: Twitter Launched
description: Twitter launched as a microblogging platform where users could share short updates.

title: First Android Phone Released
description: The first Android smartphone, the HTC Dream, was released, marking a new era in mobile technology.

title: Git Released
description: Linus Torvalds created Git, a distributed version control system widely used in software development.

title: First Video Game Created
description: William Higinbotham created one of the first video games, a tennis simulation displayed on an oscilloscope.

title: HTML Introduced
description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) was introduced, becoming the standard language for creating web pages.

title: Amazon Launched
description: Jeff Bezos launched Amazon as an online bookstore, later expanding to sell almost everything.

title: Spotify Launched
description: Spotify launched, changing the way people stream and listen to music.

title: Adobe Founded
description: Adobe was founded, becoming a leader in digital media and creativity tools.

title: Intel Founded
description: Intel was founded, becoming a leader in semiconductor technology and microprocessors.

title: Zoom Launched
description: Zoom launched as a video conferencing platform, eventually becoming a household name for remote communication.

title: TikTok Launched
description: TikTok launched as a short-form video platform, quickly becoming one of the most popular apps globally.

title: Uber Founded
description: Uber was founded, transforming urban transportation through ride-sharing technology.

title: Raspberry Pi Released
description: The Raspberry Pi, a low-cost, credit-card-sized computer, was released to promote computer science education.

title: Deep Blue Defeats Kasparov
description: IBM's Deep Blue supercomputer defeated world chess champion Garry Kasparov, marking a milestone in AI.

title: First Blockchain Implemented
description: The first blockchain was implemented as part of Bitcoin, providing the foundation for decentralized technologies.

title: ARPANET Created
description: The ARPANET, a precursor to the modern Internet, was created as a research project funded by the U.S. Department of Defense. With the four original network nodes locatedc at: SRI, the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA); the University of California, Santa Barbara; and the University of Utah.

title: Tesla Roadster Unveiled
description: Tesla unveiled the Roadster, the first all-electric sports car, showcasing the potential of electric vehicles.

title: MIT AI Lab Founded
description: The MIT Artificial Intelligence Lab was founded, becoming a leading institution for AI research.

title: Open Source Initiative Founded
description: The Open Source Initiative was founded to promote and protect open-source software.

title: First Smartphone Released
description: IBM released the Simon Personal Communicator, widely regarded as the first smartphone.

title: Hadoop Released
description: Hadoop, an open-source framework for processing large data sets, was released.

title: Bluetooth Technology Introduced
description: Bluetooth wireless technology was introduced, enabling short-range data exchanges.

title: First Graphical Browser Released
description: Mosaic, the first popular graphical web browser, was released, accelerating the adoption of the Internet.
